author: Lowkeys
post_text: July 24, 2019 at 10:09â€¯PM#1Hey guys! I have a syntax that reads this:Assign Root ."Macros"."Global"."Selection at 0% Exec".9  Thru .12 /Disabled="Yes"Which works perfectly fine. It disables only steps 9 thru 12 in that macro.However, this syntax:Assign Root ."Macros"."Global"."Selection at 0% Exec".13  Thru .16 /Disabled="Yes"Will disable steps 13 thru 17 (step 17 being the last one in the macro)What am I missing here? I also have lines like the above that enable/disable steps 1 thru 4 and 5 thru 8, and all of those work perfectly fine.
title: Enabling/Disabling certain macro steps
